dcterms:creator: N. Song
T. Yang
H. Sun
dcterms:description: The OSA architecture is utilized to improve the accuracy of direction-of-arrival (DOA) estimation for hybrid massive MIMO arrays, showing better performance compared to the non-overlapped subarray architecture.
dcterms:title: Overlapped Subarrays (OSA) architecture

dcterms:creator: F. Shu
Y. Qin
T. Liu
L. Gui
Y. Zhang
J. Li
Z. Han
dcterms:description: The NOSA architecture is referenced as a comparison to the OSA architecture, highlighting its lack of overlapping regions between adjacent subarrays.
dcterms:title: Non-overlapped Subarrays (NOSA) architecture

dcterms:creator: P. Vincent
H. Larochelle
Y. Bengio
P.-A. Manzagol
dcterms:description: Denoising autoencoders are used to remove noise from the input data, improving the accuracy of the DOA estimation process.
dcterms:title: Denoising Autoencoders (DAE)

dcterms:creator: Z.-M. Liu
C. Zhang
S. Y. Philip
dcterms:description: A deep neural network (DNN) is proposed for DOA estimation, demonstrating robustness to array imperfections.
dcterms:title: Deep Neural Networks (DNN) for DOA estimation

dcterms:creator: G. K. Papageorgiou
M. Sellathurai
Y. C. Eldar
dcterms:description: A convolutional neural network (CNN) is utilized for DOA estimation, particularly effective in low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) scenarios.
dcterms:title: CNN for DOA estimation

dcterms:creator: E. Tuncer
B. Friedlander
dcterms:description: The MUSIC algorithm is referenced as a traditional method for DOA estimation, serving as a benchmark for the proposed CDAE-DNN method.
dcterms:title: MUSIC algorithm for DOA estimation
